Service Details: - Provides outdoor and camp experiences to young adults and youth living with special needs and chronic illnesses- Improves participant self-esteem and confidence in a stimulating, supportive, empowering and fun environment, while ensuring physical and emotional well-being- Camps include: Hearts of Gold Camp (ages 12-17); Young Adult Camp #1 (18-30); Mixed Medical Camp #1 (Children's Heart Network, Hematology and Gastro-intestinal); CNIB (children who are blind or partially sighted); Down Syndrome, Epilepsy, and Muscular Dystrophy Week; Autism Spectrum Disorder Camp #1; Mixed Medical Camp #2 (including Craniofacial Differences; Leadership in Training; Southlands (STARS) & Alderwood Camp; Autism Spectrum Disorder Camp #2; Young Adult Camp #2 (18-40 years of age)
Eligibility: - Age range differs with each camp- Please visit the website for complete details
Cost: Service ; - Fees vary for each camp- Please visit the website on camp fees and eligibility for reduced fees/camper allowances
Major Intersection: Florence Lake Rd and Burma St
